messages.message: Hi folks, When building a list it's unclear that the clean function runs accross all fields and that its not possbile to clean a single field in the list
CLicking from Extraction to Reasoning and back I lost all my fields I configured
As a workaround I am now using the description field to do Cleaning per field

Hmm so 2 issues:
1. Toggling across reasoning and extraction does not preserve work @Serena I'd imagine autosave doesn't help here. CC: @CJ 
2. Clean applying to all fields - do you mean items? What was the clean you were using?

The UI doesn't make it clear that clean runs accross the list rather then the field I think I have selected, making my prompt more clear by declaring the field "amount" and the definition of what should happen with it, did work fine.

It just look as if I selected my field "Amoun" and was applying a clean promt to it, while I was actaully apply a clean over my list items
for 1, this is working as intended for backend reasons. we could do a workaround on the frontend side

As can be seen in your screenshot, the value shown under “Result” is the entire list-of-objects value though, and this indicates what we’ll run “Clean” on

We never show the value for just “Amount” for example, even if you have “Amount” selected

As Serena mentioned cleans will apply to the result of the previous step (whether is that is an extraction, reasoning, or another clean). For 1, we can consider also just showing a minor message or model but that seems too disruptive
